column1: 0,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,30,dae40b69dd87c30f9c6906f2490ad285731005a71ccdd0eb891f3d92b0baff03,"If 1oo2 evaluation is to be implemented on the module, you can find the parameter description for discrepancy handling in the online help.

Here, you can switch off HART communication on specific channels in a non-safety-related manner, as well as enable HART diagnostics options and determine how often the module will attempt to establish HART communication with the transducer before a message is issued.
In the case of HART devices for which parameter assignment cannot be interlocked, HART communication must be switched off.
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules
# 6.4.12 Parameter assignment for EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

You use this parameter to determine when a discrepancy error is considered lifted and, therefore, when a reintegration of the affected input channels is possible. You can choose between the following parameter options:

If you have configured ""Test 0 signal necessary"", a discrepancy error is only considered lifted once a 0 signal is present at both input channels concerned. ",What is the purpose of the 'Discrepancy time (ms)' parameter in the FAI6xISBit HART module?,The 'Discrepancy time (ms)' parameter specifies the time frame within which discrepancies between sensor inputs must be resolved to avoid a fault.,It defines the maximum allowed time difference between inputs from redundant sensors before a discrepancy error is triggered.,"This parameter sets how long the module waits for inputs to match before declaring a discrepancy error, ensuring safety and reliability.","Used to configure the tolerance period for input signal discrepancies, enhancing system safety by allowing time for signal alignment.","Determines the duration the system tolerates input mismatches, crucial for maintaining operational integrity in safety-related applications."

1,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,30,dae40b69dd87c30f9c6906f2490ad285731005a71ccdd0eb891f3d92b0baff03,"If 1oo2 evaluation is to be implemented on the module, you can find the parameter description for discrepancy handling in the online help.

Here, you can switch off HART communication on specific channels in a non-safety-related manner, as well as enable HART diagnostics options and determine how often the module will attempt to establish HART communication with the transducer before a message is issued.
In the case of HART devices for which parameter assignment cannot be interlocked, HART communication must be switched off.
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules
# 6.4.12 Parameter assignment for EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

You use this parameter to determine when a discrepancy error is considered lifted and, therefore, when a reintegration of the affected input channels is possible. You can choose between the following parameter options:

If you have configured ""Test 0 signal necessary"", a discrepancy error is only considered lifted once a 0 signal is present at both input channels concerned. ",How can HART communication be managed on specific channels in the FAI6xISBit HART module?,"HART communication can be disabled on specific channels non-safety-relatedly, and diagnostic options can be enabled.","The module allows for the selective deactivation of HART communication on certain channels, alongside enabling diagnostics.",Users have the option to turn off HART communication on particular channels and configure diagnostic settings as needed.,Management includes disabling HART on chosen channels and setting up diagnostics to monitor communication attempts.,Configurable settings permit the shutdown of HART on specific channels and the activation of diagnostic features for monitoring.

2,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,30,dae40b69dd87c30f9c6906f2490ad285731005a71ccdd0eb891f3d92b0baff03,"If 1oo2 evaluation is to be implemented on the module, you can find the parameter description for discrepancy handling in the online help.

# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

You use this parameter to determine when a discrepancy error is considered lifted and, therefore, when a reintegration of the affected input channels is possible. You can choose between the following parameter options:

",What must be done for HART devices with non-interlockable parameter assignment in the FAI6xISBit HART module?,HART communication must be switched off for devices where parameter assignment cannot be interlocked.,"For such devices, it's necessary to disable HART communication to ensure system safety.",Turning off HART communication is mandatory for devices lacking interlockable parameter assignment.,Devices without the capability for interlocked parameter assignment require the deactivation of HART communication.,"To maintain safety, HART communication should be disabled on devices that don't support interlocked parameter assignment."

3,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,30,dae40b69dd87c30f9c6906f2490ad285731005a71ccdd0eb891f3d92b0baff03,"If 1oo2 evaluation is to be implemented on the module, you can find the parameter description for discrepancy handling in the online help.

# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

You use this parameter to determine when a discrepancy error is considered lifted and, therefore, when a reintegration of the affected input channels is possible. You can choose between the following parameter options:

If you have configured ""Test 0 signal necessary"", a discrepancy error is only considered lifted once a 0 signal is present at both input channels concerned. ",What options are available for reintegration following a discrepancy error in the F-signal modules?,"Options include 'Test 0 signal necessary', where a 0 signal at both input channels is required for reintegration.","One can choose 'Test 0 signal necessary' for reintegration, demanding a 0 signal on both channels to clear the error.",Reintegration post-discrepancy error requires a 0 signal on both affected channels if 'Test 0 signal necessary' is selected.,"The parameter 'Test 0 signal necessary' ensures reintegration only after both channels show a 0 signal, resolving the discrepancy.","For discrepancy error resolution, selecting 'Test 0 signal necessary' mandates a 0 signal presence on both channels for reintegration."

","What is the significance of the 'Tolerance window % rel,' parameter in the FAI6xISBit HART module?",It defines the relative tolerance percentage allowed between sensor inputs to prevent discrepancy errors.,This parameter sets the permissible percentage difference between redundant sensor inputs for normal operation.,"The 'Tolerance window % rel,' specifies the acceptable variance percentage between inputs to avoid fault conditions.","It establishes a relative tolerance threshold, ensuring inputs can vary within a set percentage without triggering errors.",Determines the maximum relative deviation percentage between sensor signals that the system tolerates before flagging a discrepancy.

",How is the 'Input delay' parameter utilized in the EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex module?,The 'Input delay' parameter sets the time delay before the module processes input signals from NAMUR sensors.,It configures the delay period applied to input signals to ensure accurate and stable readings from NAMUR sensors.,"This parameter adjusts the wait time before input signals are evaluated, enhancing signal reliability.","Used to specify the duration the module waits before reading inputs, crucial for filtering out transient noise.","Defines the pause before signal processing begins, aiding in the elimination of false readings due to signal fluctuations."

",What diagnostic options are available for the EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex module?,"Diagnostics include short circuit detection, wire break monitoring, and flutter monitoring.","The module offers diagnostics for identifying short circuits, wire breaks, and monitoring signal flutter.","Available diagnostic features encompass short circuit and wire break detection, along with flutter monitoring.","It provides diagnostic capabilities for detecting short circuits, wire breaks, and assessing signal stability through flutter monitoring.","Enables the detection of electrical faults like short circuits and wire breaks, plus monitoring for signal instability via flutter diagnostics."

",What is the purpose of the 'Flutter monitoring' feature in the EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex module?,"Flutter monitoring detects and alerts to rapid, unstable changes in the input signal.","It identifies unstable signal conditions, known as flutter, to prevent false readings.","This feature monitors for erratic signal variations, ensuring reliable input data.","Designed to catch and report signal instability, enhancing the accuracy of sensor readings.",Ensures signal integrity by detecting and flagging rapid fluctuations in input signals.

",How does the 'Sensor supply test' function contribute to the EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex module's operation?,The 'Sensor supply test' verifies the integrity of the sensor's power supply.,"It checks the sensor's power supply for faults, ensuring reliable sensor operation.",This function tests the sensor supply to detect any issues that could affect performance.,"Ensures the sensor's power source is functioning correctly, preventing operational failures.","A diagnostic tool that assesses the sensor's supply voltage for anomalies, safeguarding against power-related errors."

","What is the role of the 'Startup time of se,' parameter in the EM 8 F-DI NAMUR Ex module?","The 'Startup time of se,' parameter defines the initialization period for the sensor.",It sets the duration required for the sensor to stabilize after power-up before active monitoring begins.,This parameter specifies the wait time post-startup to ensure the sensor is ready for accurate readings.,"Determines the stabilization phase for the sensor, ensuring reliable data from the outset.","Configures the initial delay after startup, allowing the sensor to reach operational stability before processing inputs."
